intro: Bupleurum gerardi var. jacquinianum, commonly known as the Jacobine bugloss, is a perennial herb native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring finely divided, fern-like leaves. Its flowers are small, white to pale blue, and bloom in late spring to early summer. This species is often found in moist, open habitats such as woodlands and streambanks.
